newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli business leader slams IMF stance.
newsitem.headline: Israeli business leader slams IMF stance.

text.p: The head of Israel's Manufacturers Association criticised the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for strongly supporting the Bank of Israel's tight monetary policy, the association said on Tuesday.
In a letter to IMF Director-General Michel Camdessus, Dan Propper said an interim IMF report released on September 11 supported the central bank's policy without any mention of opposing views.
A full text of the letter appeared in Hebrew translation in the Israeli business daily Globes, but the association refused to release the original English-language version.

Propper said he and other business leaders had told a visiting IMF team that the Bank of Israel had artificially reduced inflation by raising interest rates, thus causing the shekel to become overvalued.
He said high interest rates had damaged the domestic capital market and had worsened Israel's current account deficit.

In its interim report the IMF criticised Israel's expansionary fiscal policy and praised the current government for seeking to restrain spending. It supported Bank of Israel policy, which caused short-term base rates to rise to as much as 17.0 percent earlier this year. A final report is due by year end.
Propper has waged a long-running war against the central bank and its governor, Jacob Frenkel, over monetary policy.
